item.title: Invisible Structures of Reality
item.description:
Invisible Structures: Dark Matter, Entropy, and the Human Search for Order

The universe appears luminous and structured on the surface. Stars shine, galaxies rotate gracefully, and physical laws seem orderly and precise. Yet, modern physics reveals a profound truth beneath this apparent clarity: most of what governs the universe is invisible. Dark matter, entropy, and chaotic dynamics quietly shape reality without announcing themselves. In understanding these concepts together, we also uncover something deeply humanâ€”our constant struggle to create meaning and order within uncertainty.
